33#ifndef _TTM_BO_API_H_
34#define _TTM_BO_API_H_
35
36#ifdef __NetBSD__
37#include <sys/types.h>
38#include <sys/param.h>
39#include <sys/mutex.h> /* XXX ugh include order botch */
40#include <uvm/uvm_object.h>
41#include <uvm/uvm_param.h>
42#include <uvm/uvm_prot.h>
43#endif
44
45#include <drm/drm_hashtab.h>
46#include <drm/drm_vma_manager.h>
47#include <linux/atomic.h>
48#include <linux/kref.h>
49#include <linux/list.h>
50#include <linux/wait.h>
51#include <linux/mutex.h>
52#include <linux/mm.h>
53#include <linux/bitmap.h>
54#include <linux/reservation.h>
55
56struct ttm_bo_device;
57
58struct drm_mm_node;
59
60/**
61 * struct ttm_place
62 *
63 * @fpfn: first valid page frame number to put the object
64 * @lpfn: last valid page frame number to put the object
65 * @flags: memory domain and caching flags for the object
66 *
67 * Structure indicating a possible place to put an object.
68 */
69struct ttm_place {
70 unsigned fpfn;
71 unsigned lpfn;
72 uint32_t flags;
73};
74
75/**
76 * struct ttm_placement
77 *
78 * @num_placement: number of preferred placements
79 * @placement: preferred placements
80 * @num_busy_placement: number of preferred placements when need to evict buffer
81 * @busy_placement: preferred placements when need to evict buffer
82 *
83 * Structure indicating the placement you request for an object.
84 */
85struct ttm_placement {
86 unsigned num_placement;
87 const struct ttm_place *placement;
88 unsigned num_busy_placement;
89 const struct ttm_place *busy_placement;
90};
91
92/**
93 * struct ttm_bus_placement
94 *
95 * @addr: mapped virtual address
96 * @base: bus base address
97 * @is_iomem: is this io memory ?
98 * @size: size in byte
99 * @offset: offset from the base address
100 * @io_reserved_vm: The VM system has a refcount in @io_reserved_count
101 * @io_reserved_count: Refcounting the numbers of callers to ttm_mem_io_reserve
102 *
103 * Structure indicating the bus placement of an object.
104 */
105struct ttm_bus_placement {
106 void *addr;
107 unsigned long base;
108 unsigned long size;
109 unsigned long offset;
110 bool is_iomem;
111 bool io_reserved_vm;
112 uint64_t io_reserved_count;
113#ifdef __NetBSD__
114 bus_space_handle_t memh;
115#endif
116};
117
118
119/**
120 * struct ttm_mem_reg
121 *
122 * @mm_node: Memory manager node.
123 * @size: Requested size of memory region.
124 * @num_pages: Actual size of memory region in pages.
125 * @page_alignment: Page alignment.
126 * @placement: Placement flags.
127 * @bus: Placement on io bus accessible to the CPU
128 *
129 * Structure indicating the placement and space resources used by a
130 * buffer object.
131 */
132
133struct ttm_mem_reg {
134 void *mm_node;
135 unsigned long start;
136 unsigned long size;
137 unsigned long num_pages;
138 uint32_t page_alignment;
139 uint32_t mem_type;
140 uint32_t placement;
141 struct ttm_bus_placement bus;
142};
143
144/**
145 * enum ttm_bo_type
146 *
147 * @ttm_bo_type_device: These are 'normal' buffers that can
148 * be mmapped by user space. Each of these bos occupy a slot in the
149 * device address space, that can be used for normal vm operations.
150 *
151 * @ttm_bo_type_kernel: These buffers are like ttm_bo_type_device buffers,
152 * but they cannot be accessed from user-space. For kernel-only use.
153 *
154 * @ttm_bo_type_sg: Buffer made from dmabuf sg table shared with another
155 * driver.
156 */
157
158enum ttm_bo_type {
159 ttm_bo_type_device,
160 ttm_bo_type_kernel,
161 ttm_bo_type_sg
162};
163
164struct ttm_tt;
165
166/**
167 * struct ttm_buffer_object
168 *
169 * @bdev: Pointer to the buffer object device structure.
170 * @type: The bo type.
171 * @destroy: Destruction function. If NULL, kfree is used.
172 * @num_pages: Actual number of pages.
173 * @acc_size: Accounted size for this object.
174 * @kref: Reference count of this buffer object. When this refcount reaches
175 * zero, the object is put on the delayed delete list.
176 * @list_kref: List reference count of this buffer object. This member is
177 * used to avoid destruction while the buffer object is still on a list.
178 * Lru lists may keep one refcount, the delayed delete list, and kref != 0
179 * keeps one refcount. When this refcount reaches zero,
180 * the object is destroyed.
181 * @mem: structure describing current placement.
182 * @persistent_swap_storage: Usually the swap storage is deleted for buffers
183 * pinned in physical memory. If this behaviour is not desired, this member
184 * holds a pointer to a persistent shmem object.
185 * @ttm: TTM structure holding system pages.
186 * @evicted: Whether the object was evicted without user-space knowing.
187 * @cpu_writes: For synchronization. Number of cpu writers.
188 * @lru: List head for the lru list.
189 * @ddestroy: List head for the delayed destroy list.
190 * @swap: List head for swap LRU list.
191 * @priv_flags: Flags describing buffer object internal state.
192 * @vma_node: Address space manager node.
193 * @offset: The current GPU offset, which can have different meanings
194 * depending on the memory type. For SYSTEM type memory, it should be 0.
195 * @cur_placement: Hint of current placement.
196 * @wu_mutex: Wait unreserved mutex.
197 *
198 * Base class for TTM buffer object, that deals with data placement and CPU
199 * mappings. GPU mappings are really up to the driver, but for simpler GPUs
200 * the driver can usually use the placement offset @offset directly as the
201 * GPU virtual address. For drivers implementing multiple
202 * GPU memory manager contexts, the driver should manage the address space
203 * in these contexts separately and use these objects to get the correct
204 * placement and caching for these GPU maps. This makes it possible to use
205 * these objects for even quite elaborate memory management schemes.
206 * The destroy member, the API visibility of this object makes it possible
207 * to derive driver specific types.
208 */
209
210struct ttm_buffer_object {
211 /**
212 * Members constant at init.
213 */
214
215 struct ttm_bo_global *glob;
216 struct ttm_bo_device *bdev;
217 enum ttm_bo_type type;
218 void (*destroy) (struct ttm_buffer_object *);
219 unsigned long num_pages;
220 size_t acc_size;
221#ifdef __NetBSD__
222 struct uvm_object uvmobj;
223#endif
224
225 /**
226 * Members not needing protection.
227 */
228
229 struct kref kref;
230 struct kref list_kref;
231
232 /**
233 * Members protected by the bo::resv::reserved lock.
234 */
235
236 struct ttm_mem_reg mem;
237 struct file *persistent_swap_storage;
238 struct ttm_tt *ttm;
239 bool evicted;
240
241 /**
242 * Members protected by the bo::reserved lock only when written to.
243 */
244
245 atomic_t cpu_writers;
246
247 /**
248 * Members protected by the bdev::lru_lock.
249 */
250
251 struct list_head lru;
252 struct list_head ddestroy;
253 struct list_head swap;
254 struct list_head io_reserve_lru;
255
256 /**
257 * Members protected by a bo reservation.
258 */
259
260 unsigned long priv_flags;
261
262 struct drm_vma_offset_node vma_node;
263
264 /**
265 * Special members that are protected by the reserve lock
266 * and the bo::lock when written to. Can be read with
267 * either of these locks held.
268 */
269
270 uint64_t offset; /* GPU address space is independent of CPU word size */
271 uint32_t cur_placement;
272
273 struct sg_table *sg;
274
275 struct reservation_object *resv;
276 struct reservation_object ttm_resv;
277 struct mutex wu_mutex;
278};
279
280/**
281 * struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj
282 *
283 * @virtual: The current kernel virtual address.
284 * @page: The page when kmap'ing a single page.
285 * @bo_kmap_type: Type of bo_kmap.
286 *
287 * Object describing a kernel mapping. Since a TTM bo may be located
288 * in various memory types with various caching policies, the
289 * mapping can either be an ioremap, a vmap, a kmap or part of a
290 * premapped region.
291 */
292
293#define TTM_BO_MAP_IOMEM_MASK 0x80
294struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj {
295 void *virtual;
296#ifdef __NetBSD__
297 union {
298 struct {
299 bus_space_handle_t memh;
300 bus_size_t size;
301 } io;
302 struct {
303 vsize_t vsize;
304 } vmapped;
305 struct {
306 struct page *page;
307 } kmapped;
308 } u;
309#else
310 struct page *page;
311#endif
312 enum {
313 ttm_bo_map_iomap = 1 | TTM_BO_MAP_IOMEM_MASK,
314 ttm_bo_map_vmap = 2,
315 ttm_bo_map_kmap = 3,
316 ttm_bo_map_premapped = 4 | TTM_BO_MAP_IOMEM_MASK,
317 } bo_kmap_type;
318 struct ttm_buffer_object *bo;
319};
320
321/**
322 * ttm_bo_reference - reference a struct ttm_buffer_object
323 *
324 * @bo: The buffer object.
325 *
326 * Returns a refcounted pointer to a buffer object.
327 */
328
329static inline struct ttm_buffer_object *
330ttm_bo_reference(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo)
331{
332 kref_get(&bo->kref);
333 return bo;
334}
335
336/**
337 * ttm_bo_wait - wait for buffer idle.
338 *
339 * @bo: The buffer object.
340 * @interruptible: Use interruptible wait.
341 * @no_wait: Return immediately if buffer is busy.
342 *
343 * This function must be called with the bo::mutex held, and makes
344 * sure any previous rendering to the buffer is completed.
345 * Note: It might be necessary to block validations before the
346 * wait by reserving the buffer.
347 * Returns -EBUSY if no_wait is true and the buffer is busy.
348 * Returns -ERESTARTSYS if interrupted by a signal.
349 */
350extern int ttm_bo_wait(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo, bool lazy,
351 bool interruptible, bool no_wait);
352
353/**
354 * ttm_bo_mem_compat - Check if proposed placement is compatible with a bo
355 *
356 * @placement: Return immediately if buffer is busy.
357 * @mem: The struct ttm_mem_reg indicating the region where the bo resides
358 * @new_flags: Describes compatible placement found
359 *
360 * Returns true if the placement is compatible
361 */
362extern bool ttm_bo_mem_compat(struct ttm_placement *placement,
363 struct ttm_mem_reg *mem,
364 uint32_t *new_flags);
365
366/**
367 * ttm_bo_validate
368 *
369 * @bo: The buffer object.
370 * @placement: Proposed placement for the buffer object.
371 * @interruptible: Sleep interruptible if sleeping.
372 * @no_wait_gpu: Return immediately if the GPU is busy.
373 *
374 * Changes placement and caching policy of the buffer object
375 * according proposed placement.
376 * Returns
377 * -EINVAL on invalid proposed placement.
378 * -ENOMEM on out-of-memory condition.
379 * -EBUSY if no_wait is true and buffer busy.
380 * -ERESTARTSYS if interrupted by a signal.
381 */
382extern int ttm_bo_validate(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
383 struct ttm_placement *placement,
384 bool interruptible,
385 bool no_wait_gpu);
386
387/**
388 * ttm_bo_unref
389 *
390 * @bo: The buffer object.
391 *
392 * Unreference and clear a pointer to a buffer object.
393 */
394extern void ttm_bo_unref(struct ttm_buffer_object **bo);
395
396
397/**
398 * ttm_bo_list_ref_sub
399 *
400 * @bo: The buffer object.
401 * @count: The number of references with which to decrease @bo::list_kref;
402 * @never_free: The refcount should not reach zero with this operation.
403 *
404 * Release @count lru list references to this buffer object.
405 */
406extern void ttm_bo_list_ref_sub(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo, int count,
407 bool never_free);
408
409/**
410 * ttm_bo_add_to_lru
411 *
412 * @bo: The buffer object.
413 *
414 * Add this bo to the relevant mem type lru and, if it's backed by
415 * system pages (ttms) to the swap list.
416 * This function must be called with struct ttm_bo_global::lru_lock held, and
417 * is typically called immediately prior to unreserving a bo.
418 */
419extern void ttm_bo_add_to_lru(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
420
421/**
422 * ttm_bo_del_from_lru
423 *
424 * @bo: The buffer object.
425 *
426 * Remove this bo from all lru lists used to lookup and reserve an object.
427 * This function must be called with struct ttm_bo_global::lru_lock held,
428 * and is usually called just immediately after the bo has been reserved to
429 * avoid recursive reservation from lru lists.
430 */
431extern int ttm_bo_del_from_lru(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
432
433
434/**
435 * ttm_bo_lock_delayed_workqueue
436 *
437 * Prevent the delayed workqueue from running.
438 * Returns
439 * True if the workqueue was queued at the time
440 */
441extern int ttm_bo_lock_delayed_workqueue(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev);
442
443/**
444 * ttm_bo_unlock_delayed_workqueue
445 *
446 * Allows the delayed workqueue to run.
447 */
448extern void ttm_bo_unlock_delayed_workqueue(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
449 int resched);
450
451/**
452 * ttm_bo_synccpu_write_grab
453 *
454 * @bo: The buffer object:
455 * @no_wait: Return immediately if buffer is busy.
456 *
457 * Synchronizes a buffer object for CPU RW access. This means
458 * command submission that affects the buffer will return -EBUSY
459 * until ttm_bo_synccpu_write_release is called.
460 *
461 * Returns
462 * -EBUSY if the buffer is busy and no_wait is true.
463 * -ERESTARTSYS if interrupted by a signal.
464 */
465extern int
466ttm_bo_synccpu_write_grab(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo, bool no_wait);
467
468/**
469 * ttm_bo_synccpu_write_release:
470 *
471 * @bo : The buffer object.
472 *
473 * Releases a synccpu lock.
474 */
475extern void ttm_bo_synccpu_write_release(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
476
477/**
478 * ttm_bo_acc_size
479 *
480 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
481 * @bo_size: size of the buffer object in byte.
482 * @struct_size: size of the structure holding buffer object datas
483 *
484 * Returns size to account for a buffer object
485 */
486size_t ttm_bo_acc_size(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
487 unsigned long bo_size,
488 unsigned struct_size);
489size_t ttm_bo_dma_acc_size(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
490 unsigned long bo_size,
491 unsigned struct_size);
492
493/**
494 * ttm_bo_init
495 *
496 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
497 * @bo: Pointer to a ttm_buffer_object to be initialized.
498 * @size: Requested size of buffer object.
499 * @type: Requested type of buffer object.
500 * @flags: Initial placement flags.
501 * @page_alignment: Data alignment in pages.
502 * @interruptible: If needing to sleep to wait for GPU resources,
503 * sleep interruptible.
504 * @persistent_swap_storage: Usually the swap storage is deleted for buffers
505 * pinned in physical memory. If this behaviour is not desired, this member
506 * holds a pointer to a persistent shmem object. Typically, this would
507 * point to the shmem object backing a GEM object if TTM is used to back a
508 * GEM user interface.
509 * @acc_size: Accounted size for this object.
510 * @resv: Pointer to a reservation_object, or NULL to let ttm allocate one.
511 * @destroy: Destroy function. Use NULL for kfree().
512 *
513 * This function initializes a pre-allocated struct ttm_buffer_object.
514 * As this object may be part of a larger structure, this function,
515 * together with the @destroy function,
516 * enables driver-specific objects derived from a ttm_buffer_object.
517 * On successful return, the object kref and list_kref are set to 1.
518 * If a failure occurs, the function will call the @destroy function, or
519 * kfree() if @destroy is NULL. Thus, after a failure, dereferencing @bo is
520 * illegal and will likely cause memory corruption.
521 *
522 * Returns
523 * -ENOMEM: Out of memory.
524 * -EINVAL: Invalid placement flags.
525 * -ERESTARTSYS: Interrupted by signal while sleeping waiting for resources.
526 */
527
528extern int ttm_bo_init(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
529 struct ttm_buffer_object *bo,
530 unsigned long size,
531 enum ttm_bo_type type,
532 struct ttm_placement *placement,
533 uint32_t page_alignment,
534 bool interrubtible,
535 struct file *persistent_swap_storage,
536 size_t acc_size,
537 struct sg_table *sg,
538 struct reservation_object *resv,
539 void (*destroy) (struct ttm_buffer_object *));
540
541/**
542 * ttm_bo_create
543 *
544 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
545 * @size: Requested size of buffer object.
546 * @type: Requested type of buffer object.
547 * @placement: Initial placement.
548 * @page_alignment: Data alignment in pages.
549 * @interruptible: If needing to sleep while waiting for GPU resources,
550 * sleep interruptible.
551 * @persistent_swap_storage: Usually the swap storage is deleted for buffers
552 * pinned in physical memory. If this behaviour is not desired, this member
553 * holds a pointer to a persistent shmem object. Typically, this would
554 * point to the shmem object backing a GEM object if TTM is used to back a
555 * GEM user interface.
556 * @p_bo: On successful completion *p_bo points to the created object.
557 *
558 * This function allocates a ttm_buffer_object, and then calls ttm_bo_init
559 * on that object. The destroy function is set to kfree().
560 * Returns
561 * -ENOMEM: Out of memory.
562 * -EINVAL: Invalid placement flags.
563 * -ERESTARTSYS: Interrupted by signal while waiting for resources.
564 */
565
566extern int ttm_bo_create(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev,
567 unsigned long size,
568 enum ttm_bo_type type,
569 struct ttm_placement *placement,
570 uint32_t page_alignment,
571 bool interruptible,
572 struct file *persistent_swap_storage,
573 struct ttm_buffer_object **p_bo);
574
575/**
576 * ttm_bo_init_mm
577 *
578 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
579 * @mem_type: The memory type.
580 * @p_size: size managed area in pages.
581 *
582 * Initialize a manager for a given memory type.
583 * Note: if part of driver firstopen, it must be protected from a
584 * potentially racing lastclose.
585 * Returns:
586 * -EINVAL: invalid size or memory type.
587 * -ENOMEM: Not enough memory.
588 * May also return driver-specified errors.
589 */
590
591extern int ttm_bo_init_mm(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, unsigned type,
592 unsigned long p_size);
593/**
594 * ttm_bo_clean_mm
595 *
596 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
597 * @mem_type: The memory type.
598 *
599 * Take down a manager for a given memory type after first walking
600 * the LRU list to evict any buffers left alive.
601 *
602 * Normally, this function is part of lastclose() or unload(), and at that
603 * point there shouldn't be any buffers left created by user-space, since
604 * there should've been removed by the file descriptor release() method.
605 * However, before this function is run, make sure to signal all sync objects,
606 * and verify that the delayed delete queue is empty. The driver must also
607 * make sure that there are no NO_EVICT buffers present in this memory type
608 * when the call is made.
609 *
610 * If this function is part of a VT switch, the caller must make sure that
611 * there are no appications currently validating buffers before this
612 * function is called. The caller can do that by first taking the
613 * struct ttm_bo_device::ttm_lock in write mode.
614 *
615 * Returns:
616 * -EINVAL: invalid or uninitialized memory type.
617 * -EBUSY: There are still buffers left in this memory type.
618 */
619
620extern int ttm_bo_clean_mm(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, unsigned mem_type);
621
622/**
623 * ttm_bo_evict_mm
624 *
625 * @bdev: Pointer to a ttm_bo_device struct.
626 * @mem_type: The memory type.
627 *
628 * Evicts all buffers on the lru list of the memory type.
629 * This is normally part of a VT switch or an
630 * out-of-memory-space-due-to-fragmentation handler.
631 * The caller must make sure that there are no other processes
632 * currently validating buffers, and can do that by taking the
633 * struct ttm_bo_device::ttm_lock in write mode.
634 *
635 * Returns:
636 * -EINVAL: Invalid or uninitialized memory type.
637 * -ERESTARTSYS: The call was interrupted by a signal while waiting to
638 * evict a buffer.
639 */
640
641extern int ttm_bo_evict_mm(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, unsigned mem_type);
642
643/**
644 * ttm_kmap_obj_virtual
645 *
646 * @map: A struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj returned from ttm_bo_kmap.
647 * @is_iomem: Pointer to an integer that on return indicates 1 if the
648 * virtual map is io memory, 0 if normal memory.
649 *
650 * Returns the virtual address of a buffer object area mapped by ttm_bo_kmap.
651 * If *is_iomem is 1 on return, the virtual address points to an io memory area,
652 * that should strictly be accessed by the iowriteXX() and similar functions.
653 */
654
655static inline void *ttm_kmap_obj_virtual(struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj *map,
656 bool *is_iomem)
657{
658 *is_iomem = !!(map->bo_kmap_type & TTM_BO_MAP_IOMEM_MASK);
659 return map->virtual;
660}
661
662/**
663 * ttm_bo_kmap
664 *
665 * @bo: The buffer object.
666 * @start_page: The first page to map.
667 * @num_pages: Number of pages to map.
668 * @map: pointer to a struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj representing the map.
669 *
670 * Sets up a kernel virtual mapping, using ioremap, vmap or kmap to the
671 * data in the buffer object. The ttm_kmap_obj_virtual function can then be
672 * used to obtain a virtual address to the data.
673 *
674 * Returns
675 * -ENOMEM: Out of memory.
676 * -EINVAL: Invalid range.
677 */
678
679extern int ttm_bo_kmap(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo, unsigned long start_page,
680 unsigned long num_pages, struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj *map);
681
682/**
683 * ttm_bo_kunmap
684 *
685 * @map: Object describing the map to unmap.
686 *
687 * Unmaps a kernel map set up by ttm_bo_kmap.
688 */
689
690extern void ttm_bo_kunmap(struct ttm_bo_kmap_obj *map);
691
692#ifdef __NetBSD__
693
694/* XXX ttm_fbdev_mmap? */
695
696extern void ttm_bo_uvm_reference(struct uvm_object *);
697extern void ttm_bo_uvm_detach(struct uvm_object *);
698extern int ttm_bo_uvm_fault(struct uvm_faultinfo *, vaddr_t, struct vm_page **,
699 int, int, vm_prot_t, int);
700extern int ttm_bo_mmap_object(struct ttm_bo_device *, off_t, size_t, vm_prot_t,
701 struct uvm_object **, voff_t *, struct file *);
702
703#else
704
705/**
706 * ttm_fbdev_mmap - mmap fbdev memory backed by a ttm buffer object.
707 *
708 * @vma: vma as input from the fbdev mmap method.
709 * @bo: The bo backing the address space. The address space will
710 * have the same size as the bo, and start at offset 0.
711 *
712 * This function is intended to be called by the fbdev mmap method
713 * if the fbdev address space is to be backed by a bo.
714 */
715
716extern int ttm_fbdev_mmap(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
717 struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
718
719/**
720 * ttm_bo_mmap - mmap out of the ttm device address space.
721 *
722 * @filp: filp as input from the mmap method.
723 * @vma: vma as input from the mmap method.
724 * @bdev: Pointer to the ttm_bo_device with the address space manager.
725 *
726 * This function is intended to be called by the device mmap method.
727 * if the device address space is to be backed by the bo manager.
728 */
729
730extern int ttm_bo_mmap(struct file *filp, struct vm_area_struct *vma,
731 struct ttm_bo_device *bdev);
732
733#endif /* __NetBSD__ */
734
735/**
736 * ttm_bo_io
737 *
738 * @bdev: Pointer to the struct ttm_bo_device.
739 * @filp: Pointer to the struct file attempting to read / write.
740 * @wbuf: User-space pointer to address of buffer to write. NULL on read.
741 * @rbuf: User-space pointer to address of buffer to read into.
742 * Null on write.
743 * @count: Number of bytes to read / write.
744 * @f_pos: Pointer to current file position.
745 * @write: 1 for read, 0 for write.
746 *
747 * This function implements read / write into ttm buffer objects, and is
748 * intended to
749 * be called from the fops::read and fops::write method.
750 * Returns:
751 * See man (2) write, man(2) read. In particular,
752 * the function may return -ERESTARTSYS if
753 * interrupted by a signal.
754 */
755
756extern ssize_t ttm_bo_io(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev, struct file *filp,
757 const char __user *wbuf, char __user *rbuf,
758 size_t count, loff_t *f_pos, bool write);
759
760extern void ttm_bo_swapout_all(struct ttm_bo_device *bdev);
761extern int ttm_bo_wait_unreserved(struct ttm_buffer_object *bo);
762#endif
